chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why Core Web Vitals are necessary.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Like this video and keep high energy.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The thing is that your website should be in your iPhone, iPad, Android, Surface Pro 4 devices.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Because we have to give good experience to all users through our website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: In this video, we will also learn about Chrome's hidden tool which is called Lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: How can you use it to enhance your website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: In the comment section, write down Sigma Batch OP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Let's go to the computer screen and let's roll the intro.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So guys, I have come to my computer screen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And I will make a new folder which is called Video 6.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Video 6.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And in Video 6, I will click on VS Code as always.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And today, I am going to tell you about SEO.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: First of all, I want to tell you what SEO is.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: You can see any website and it has SEO.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Let's take an example of Amazon.in.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I opened Amazon.in and I wanted to download this website as soon as possible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So that they can get their products in the search.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Google is a search engine.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Google's responsibility is to show good pages to users.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So Google will only show those pages which will be fast.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: They present good information and along with that,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: there are some things which are good for users.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: For example, there are two pages from the editor.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: One page has told about Dogfood.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The other page has also told about Dogfood.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: But among these two, page 2 is very fast and loads well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So Google will give more preference to it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Along with that, there are core web vitals which Google considers to rank two pages.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: First of all, content is the most important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: If your content is good, you can rank it without the code web vitals.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: But if you are competing with a page with the same content,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: which has a similar quality content,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: then your core web vitals will be seen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: If your core web vitals are good, you will be given preference.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So the first thing that comes in core web vitals is your CLS.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Look at this video which I have run on the web.dev website.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: You will see that someone comes to your website and in order to cancel it,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: the error that was made by the person who canceled it,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: the above thing became visible.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And it shifted the layout.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And the order was completed.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: But if the user wanted the order to be completed, he wanted to click on it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: In this way, the user experience is very bad.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And as you saw in this video, this shouldn't happen.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: That's why our CLS should be at least.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now what is the definition of CLS?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Cumulative layout shift means,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: how much the page is shifting while loading.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose you have loaded the page and you get to see this first.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: This was above and after that, when this load was loaded,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: then all this shifted down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The layout shouldn't shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: If you put vit and ride in images, then the layout shouldn't shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And LCP stands for largest contextual paint.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: This means that if the user is viewing a page,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: then the biggest element is on it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: For example, the biggest part in this is this image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: How long does it load?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The entire page will be loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: But the biggest element which is most important is how long does it load?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The meaning of web.dev and Google is a good LCP score.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: It should be 2.5 seconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Meaning, the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Then comes the third metric which is FID.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Which stands for First Input Delay.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The first input delay means that if a user clicks on an input element,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: like on the button or any type of input given on a page,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: then how long does that input process take?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: For example, if you click on a button,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: then the button click browser processes in how long?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And the meaning of Google and web.dev is that it should start processing in less than 100 milliseconds.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So these were the three core web vitals which are very important.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I will tell you for the information that these core web vitals are updated too.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: But these are very important and you should know.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now I will show you what the Lighthouse report is and why it is generated.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And how will you get these core web vitals value from there?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So I will tell you here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: If you will inspect it right click and you can see that it is coming on the right side.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So you can click here and drag it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: You can drag it down again and drag it down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I prefer to drag it down because it is my habit to look down from the beginning.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now here you can see the option of Lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Lighthouse basically generates a report and tells you what can be improved in your HTML page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: For example, if I want to see in mobile that how mobile users see my website,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: then I will click on mobile or I will click on desktop and close this tab.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I will click on mobile and here I will click on analyze page load.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So this will generate a report for me.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: You can see that a report is generated here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Performance, accessibility, best practices, SEO and PWA are all shown here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now here you can see that some things are showing in red.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: That is the scope of improvement is in the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now here you are telling that you should size your images properly.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: 2.7 seconds fast your website can be loaded.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So all these suggestions are given to you by Lighthouse.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And if you incorporate these suggestions, then your website will be loaded very well and the user will have a good experience.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now you can see that image elements do not have explicit width and height.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So you should give width and height.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The width and height attribute of image that we read in the last video should be used.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So that it is reserved in your browser.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: When we set width and height in HTML, then space in the browser is reserved.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Otherwise, if we do not set height and width, then what will happen is that the browser will not tell us how much space we have to reserve.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And the longer the CSS load, the lower the page will shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So we do not want our page to shift in loading time.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: If our page starts shifting, then if we click here, then when it shifts from the wrong side, then it can be done.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: We click here and sit.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Suppose there was an image going here, I click here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And the time I clicked here, this image is loaded and all these buttons are shifted down.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And instead of clicking here, I will click on the image.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: This is called cumulative layout shift.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So this kind of shift is not preferred at all.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Google does not prefer it at all.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And this should be at least.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: You can see that the space is very less.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So we have to keep the cumulative layout shift at least.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So that our user can get a very good experience.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So here we get a lot of other suggestions.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And this is for our mobile.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now we can generate desktop reports.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So as you can see, it has generated a report.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: It has 92 marks in performance.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: It has given 100 out of 100 in accessibility.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: In best practices, 75 in SEO, 75.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now here you can see that whatever good things are told here.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And whatever light house you tell.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So this is a hidden tool that we should use.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now I want to tell you about meta tags and meta description.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So what I will do here is I will make a new file.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I will name it index.html.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And after making one HTML file,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: The first SEO element that I want to tell you is title.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Your title reflects your page content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: So this is a very good SEO practice.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Whenever your page change is happening,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Make the title like this.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: That reflects your page content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Because if you want your website on Google,

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Then it will come according to the title.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: From Google's index, you can write code with Harry.

chunks.text: And you write like this.

chunks.text: This is the title of the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And this is the title of the page.

chunks.text: This is the title of the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: This is the title of the page.

chunks.text: This is the title of the page.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And the title reflects your page content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Truly, then your website will rank very well.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now here I will put the content.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I will put an H1 and write Harry.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And after that I will write a paragraph.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: And here I will write Lorem45.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: Now I have written Lorem45.

chunks.text: I will write the view word.

chunks.text: Why did I write 45? This is a very good question.

chunks.text: I wrote 45 because I am in the Alcio and 4 or 5.

chunks.text: So I have given 4 or 5.

chunks.text: Now I will quickly preview it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: I will open it and browse it.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: This document is written.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: If I leave it like this, then it will not be a good practice.

chunks.text: And I will write code with Harry.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4

chunks.text: So what will happen if I do this?

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4
chunks.text: My website will increase in the chances of seeing in Google.

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4

chunks.title: SEO and Core Web Vitals in HTML _ Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #6.mp4

text: In today's video, we will learn about Core Web Vitals and why Core Web Vitals are necessary. Like this video and keep high energy. The thing is that your website should be in your iPhone, iPad, Android, Surface Pro 4 devices. Because we have to give good experience to all users through our website. In this video, we will also learn about Chrome's hidden tool which is called Lighthouse. How can you use it to enhance your website. In the comment section, write down Sigma Batch OP. Let's go to the computer screen and let's roll the intro. So guys, I have come to my computer screen. And I will make a new folder which is called Video 6. Video 6. And in Video 6, I will click on VS Code as always. And today, I am going to tell you about SEO. First of all, I want to tell you what SEO is. SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization. You can see any website and it has SEO. Let's take an example of Amazon.in. I opened Amazon.in and I wanted to download this website as soon as possible. So that they can get their products in the search. Google is a search engine. Google's responsibility is to show good pages to users. So Google will only show those pages which will be fast. They present good information and along with that, there are some things which are good for users. For example, there are two pages from the editor. One page has told about Dogfood. The other page has also told about Dogfood. But among these two, page 2 is very fast and loads well. So Google will give more preference to it. Along with that, there are core web vitals which Google considers to rank two pages. First of all, content is the most important. If your content is good, you can rank it without the code web vitals. But if you are competing with a page with the same content, which has a similar quality content, then your core web vitals will be seen. If your core web vitals are good, you will be given preference. So the first thing that comes in core web vitals is your CLS. Look at this video which I have run on the web.dev website. You will see that someone comes to your website and in order to cancel it, the error that was made by the person who canceled it, the above thing became visible. And it shifted the layout. And the order was completed. But if the user wanted the order to be completed, he wanted to click on it. In this way, the user experience is very bad. And as you saw in this video, this shouldn't happen. That's why our CLS should be at least. Now what is the definition of CLS? Cumulative layout shift means, how much the page is shifting while loading. Suppose you have loaded the page and you get to see this first. This was above and after that, when this load was loaded, then all this shifted down. The layout shouldn't shift. If you put vit and ride in images, then the layout shouldn't shift. The next metric we are going to talk about is LCP. And LCP stands for largest contextual paint. This means that if the user is viewing a page, then the biggest element is on it. For example, the biggest part in this is this image. How long does it load? The entire page will be loaded. But the biggest element which is most important is how long does it load? The meaning of web.dev and Google is a good LCP score. It should be 2.5 seconds. Meaning, the biggest element should be loaded in 2.5 seconds. Then comes the third metric which is FID. Which stands for First Input Delay. The first input delay means that if a user clicks on an input element, like on the button or any type of input given on a page, then how long does that input process take? For example, if you click on a button, then the button click browser processes in how long? And the meaning of Google and web.dev is that it should start processing in less than 100 milliseconds. So these were the three core web vitals which are very important. I will tell you for the information that these core web vitals are updated too. But these are very important and you should know.
